column1: Meet Loten. He is a long-billed sunbird. His feathers are purple and maroon. The yellow and grey bird is his sister
column2: Lily.Sunbirds like Loten and Lily live in parts of India and Sri Lanka. They are as long as a 100-rupee note and weigh as much as a ten-rupee coin.Loten and Lily have curved beaks and tube-shaped tongues to gather nectar from flowers. When Loten and Lily were babies
column4: wide beaks so that their parents could feed them easily. Their parents digested the food a little in their stomachs before feeding it to them.When they grew strong enough
column5: Loten and Lily learnt to fly. They also had to learn to find their own food.Loten and Lily get energy from what they eat and drink. This energy allows them to use their muscles to fly. Unlike us humans
column6: Loten and Lily cannot store much energy in their bodies as fat. They have to stay very light. Otherwise
column7: they will not be able to fly.This is why sunbirds have to eat many times a day. In fact
column8: they spend most of their days flying around
